OzMIEwbYZlQKqUVsvzx6fQ.text: This place is nice and definitely deserves a more in depth, studious return to sample the food. The place is deceptively large with some wonderfully intriguing decorations, with the odd hidden nook that had me thinking of Alice in Wonderland in a barn like rustic kind of way. The drinks offerings are great with draught and a decent wine list to back up the smart spirits selection. The Orange smacks of being a gastropub, with that decidedly West Side money, cool vibe. I liked the place and would definitely recommend.

w9dw2ODUA30-fvSyJKC-mg.text: We've been meaning to eat here for some time. Definitely a great addition to the neighbourhood especially with the 4 great hotel rooms on top of the restaurant. Bring back some hip old English traditions of the public house. Recomment the spiced salami, wild mushroom and artichoke pizza. Just delicious. Overall great quality food. Only problem is place too crowded these days!

VkHVpiPmbRnry38PR4CbGQ.text: A new and welcome addition to the not too sizzling area between Pimlico and Chelsea, The Orange is a pub/restaurant/B&B from the same property of the (lovely) Thomas Cubitt with a different kind of atmosphere from the posh pub a couple of blocks away.Here the tones are lighter and brighter, the atmosphere is generally warmer. The furniture has a sort of a country look, with clear, solid wood tables and chairs and waiters in aprons. The bar looks good (although I'm more interested in food), with the usual choice of beers and ales and a couple of interesting spirits on the back panel. They serve reasonably good cocktails (I could even order a Negroni with the bartender not looking scared at me), which is a plus.The food is reasonably good and reasonably priced. Except for the pizzas, which - although not at the appalling level of the likes of Pizza Express - are NGFI (Not Good For Italians): they're surely good enough for un-picky natives that don't horrify against an imperfect, slightly overcooked dough, cooked fennel on the sausages, sliced raw tomatoes mixed with the salsa, etc (I'll simply go back to Oliveto, not far from here, when I want a pizza nearby).Apart from the pizza, we were happy with the soup of the day, and found the wild boar + chestnut + chorizo stew pretty good despite the fact that there were no chestnuts in the mix (and they had been cheekily replaced by mushrooms).So, I realize I have mixed feelings: the ambiance is good, the location is very nice (the small square where The Orange is is one of my favourites in London and has the added bonus of being 5m from where I live), the food seems wisely sourced (in part from the farmers market that is kept every Saturday in the surroundings), the menu is interesting but... the quality must improve. And I'll be back to check that it actually happens.

2U7ORM9K2RO0Jt4VS_ApYA.text: Great place to have lunch! The service was impecable, waiter really nice and the pizzas are delicious. Strongly recommend their basil fawlty cocktail

PJGpLWnIZcL9a8cD4yOcwA.text: Popped in here after Yelp's Pub Olympics event. It's a perfectly reasonable pub - thought the clientele, with the exception of 1 rather disheveled and slightly drunk individual, looked a bit more financially secure than us lot. We enjoyed the booze, the company and the conversation, maybe not so much the prices. Probably on par for this area though. The place itself is quite large, with an interesting decor.The staff were a little slow, but did get to you eventually, even if it looked like there was nothing else for them to do.Can't comment on food, but if other reviews are true, I'd avoid paying high fares for poor fayre!

jitqQHbY9F1lKaQ6D6f00w.text: The Orange is a lovely pub/resturant on Pimlioc Road away from the hustle and bustle and a world away from Victoria which in reality is just up the road.The interior is cosy with an open fire and old rustic furniture. It has a very local feel but the locals happen to be quite well heeled so there is an upmarket air to the drinks and food and hence the prices are higher than your regualr run of the mill local but they are not over the top and the quality is good.You are able to eat in the resturant or the bar and the food is delicious which a great choice from pizza's to Poussin.The choice if drinks also is vast there is a good wine list and also a small selectin of cocktails. Also the service is promt and friendly.Certianly worth wandering off the beaten track for the this cute little place.

0__3ct0OSBoFbu207gex1Q.text: very cute and nice place, but the food is ok.  i had a grilled prawn salad, and it was so small that i had to still eat a couple slices of pizza.  the pizzas were ok but nothing to write home about.the drinks are really good though, and they have an extensive cocktail menu.

UcfLdRk-6_9GCWpskdzlRQ.text: I've been obsessed with their fennel, pea and broad bean salad since I went there last month. So much so that I found a similar recipe online and have been making it for myself on a weekly basis! Great cozy atmosphere in the upstairs dining area and the fact that they carry Meantime ale on draught is a bonus!

jOM3-hp8Hb5AV-bslrYPzA.text: It has been interesting to read the various reviews on here ... On the whole, I quite enjoyed my Sunday lunch with the family (although I think my choice of pizza was probably not the best option of the day); location and layout of the pub are great, staff were very friendly and particularly kind given that I was still feeling rough from the previous night and the food was relatively prompt. Only 'negative' I would suggest is that there are other similar quality pubs around with better pricing; but overall I'd be more than happy to head back there!

T9ZAgIUcoh1QhyrBKKmi3w.text: went here for dinner the other night and while the service left something to be desired, the food was amazing and i'll definitely be back.we started with the octopus salad, garlic pizza bread, and calamari. all delicious. the bread is pretty so so though so like get the other stuff first.for dinner, i had the salmon which was amazing. cooked to perfection and the potatoes you get with them had the most delicious sauce. my friend had a small pizza which looked pretty good but i didn't have any.we had the grenache for the wine and for the £22 pound price point it was darn good. will definitely go back. it's also just a really cute place - amazing ambiance especially at christmas with all the holiday lights and roaring fires.

f4aIECPvnABoyhjhlpj8hA.text: the food here is great.....when it arrives! we waited 45 minutes for our mains and over 20 for dessert, but I will say a few things in their defense. They were incredibly busy, it was a Sunday afternoon, AND this is what saved them....the host comped our desserts which was a huge bonus. The pork roast is awesome (lots of crunchy crackling bits which were very tasty). The chocolate cherry cake is killer and if you happen to be at the restaurant at an off time, you might get the bonus spot in front of the fireplace! make reservations for the much nicer dining space (great windows/ atmosphere) upstairs. Acoustics are a bit crap at this venue if you are looking for a group discussion!

rQFVKPhlRkeEPBQ0H_qe4Q.text: The Orange is a great little pub, restaurant, and hotel off the side streets of Sloane Square. There's a great tropic feel to the place with awesome interior that transport you from London. They have a great selection of cocktails from mojitos to martinis at a reasonable price. Make sure you stop by the restaurant and try one of their starters (I recommend the beetroot, fig, and goat cheese tart) and a pizza (the aubergine, mint and pea). This place is definitely worth a stop by if in the area.

g4fBUC7JRps1HprOfXCLxg.text: This restaurant was a lot of fun.  The atmosphere is great; it's rustic and inviting.  The food was great. But as other people have suggested, the wait time for our food was a bit long, but it wasn't quite as long as other people experienced. I would still recommend this restaurant, particularly if you're a local.

gZ3vo8Ay9P2oTz0L81WXdw.text: Like most gastropubs now in London, the decor is incredibly warm and very inviting.  The food is less than desirable.  My orange and chicken salad looked and tasted as if it came straight from an M&S pre-package. Despite the delicious wine, the overall experience was just over priced.  Now, if I was scoring on eye candy, it would be near four stars.  But, that comes with the neighborhood.

V3bh-Qapq34plmtB3JSIUA.text: I was there with a large group and they were good at holding our table even though we arrived an hour later than we had originally said. Other good stuff: I didn't pick the wines so I don't actually know what the wine list looked like but the three wines we had (a St. Emilion, an Italian red and what I presume what a French white) were all good choices. Our hosts had arranged so that we were eating off a three-course set menu with four choices each for first and main course, and three choices for dessert. For the starter I had a country terrine that wasn't so nicely presented but tasted good. (My neighbor's tart with beetroot, figs, shallots and goat cheese more looked tasty.) My main course was the "market fish", which was a broiled salmon that was supposed to come with scallops except they were out of scallops. (They gave me the chance to change my mind when they realized this but I chose to go for it anyway.) The dish was nice, the fish was not overdone and came with tasty starch. Finally, my dessert was a little orange and almond cake with caramel ice cream, it was nice but a tad disappointing. The courses arrived rather slowly, perhaps to some extent due to the size of our group. The decor was nice but nothing special in my mind. A colleague lamented about the three-course menu as he was more interested in their regular menu, but at least he got the beer he wanted (Harveys from Sussex). Overall a solid three stars.

mEPBQHg7ArffPbsK788HEg.text: Food was ok. Accommodating, having arrived without reservation on Saturday night.  But too noisy for comfort. Impossible to have a conversation!

z2gQq5JfZaOEf8Tj_pzYcA.text: Food was nice but overpriced service was appalling  being charged for what we didn't get and the service was very slow.

JZs5AOgJu97jFzQrE6OQqw.text: good pizza, yes pizza, in london.  think fig, gorgonzola, and prosciutto.  v casual, bar and dining area, private events downstairs.  and of course, stellar pint of deuchars!

HmVz8T579NFAOOl4ALzqfg.text: Very eclectic and cool...fabulous for a late breakfast or Sunday brunch...great soups (fave is cauliflower...mmm) and salads...also terrific steaks and frites and AMAZING wood-burning pizza...wonderful ambience...wood burning fireplace so  nice on cold days...a must when in London

0NnC8DT6J_siiDdkwDq78A.text: The Orange is decorated impeccably--it is warm and inviting, with wooden tables and chairs and a comfortable upstairs dining area in addition to its main downstairs. The lighting is only just dim enough to cast a soft and romantic glow on the furniture and the restaurant's patrons.The menu ranges from £9 small pizzas to meat mains in the £15-20 range, with several sides costing £4. The cocktail menu is extensive, but no more pricey than your average cocktail--the cheapest being around £7 and the more expensive hovering around £13. I had a sip of a basil and passionfruit concoction--pleasantly frosty, decisively well-made and finished adorably with half a passionfruit.The first thing that struck me was that the servers are aggressively and eagerly polite and helpful--I filled my glass with the bottle of still water sitting on the table and a male waiter walking by insisted on 'helping,' and finished filling my already half-full glass. I was appreciative, but I wasn't sure it was necessary.I ordered a small pizza with broccoli, red pesto, goat's cheese (available on gluten OR spelt crust!) with a side of sweet potato fries with a soft cheese--the pizza was thin and crispy and served with a bottle of chili oil. The fries were a bit on the soggy side, but nevertheless tasty and the cheese it was served with more than made up for the sogginess.Service was speedy, but on two occasions, our plates were whisked away while food was still on it--we had to ask them to leave them, as we were not finished eating. The only other aspect about dining here that I give warning about is that the water is not free--we were asked if we'd like another bottle, which we gratefully answered that we would--only to discover at the end of the meal that each bottle of still water was £2!For three mains, three sides, and two cocktails(oh and the £4 spent on still water) the bill came around to £70 for the three of us. I definitely would return and definitely recommend the food.

m5S95BGmXVuoPzNXXoljrg.text: Pitcher of pims! Similar to a fabulous sangria in the states. Great, friendly, speedy bar service. We will be back when we cross the pond again.

OfL_qXL5UU7CEL89hDrP8g.text: Fun bar downstairs, more quiet and delightful dining room upstairs with nice Sunday roast.  Biggest let-down was the luncheon service -- server seemed as if she were being bothered with our order.

jKz9d9gjf8r6KYPRjqOWBQ.text: The Orange is a causally posh [I just coined that term, feel free to pay me royalties] establishment. Everyone pops in to this gastro pub for drinks and food, but I couldn't help be feeling like I didn't have enough money in my bank account to be there. Highlights: - Cool decor. Everything is - shockingly - orange themed.- The staff was friendly, even though they were very busy.- Food was decent! - The kitchen is open late! Lowlights:- On a Saturday night, we got there at 8pm and did not get seated until 10:30pm.- The pizza I got was quite burnt.Overall: I think this would be a great place to go with a smaller group. At 10 people, there were a bit too many of us to get seated quickly.

2zjKIU3cHOqP0LKjDgKikw.text: Wonderful atmosphere, friendly service and great pizza! Thursday happy hour was very buzzy. I think the Orange is a favorite of many. Hard to choose but as a "Yank" this is probably the favorite of all the pubs in the UK I've visited.

wMj8fRrs3jHHlvOYOEyGfw.text: We came here for a quick bite to eat as we were visiting the dessert bar, nearby, at 8pm.  I was pleased with how accommodating the staff were.  The lady at the front of house had good suggestions for what we could order and still have time to eat before our other appointment.We shared a large margherita pizza with a side of cod croquettes and a couple of drinks.  The food was tasty and we were pleased with the friendly service.  We are intending to visit another time to try their Sunday roast.

_cRwhImVROfnUiYNPAuUDQ.text: We went to The Orange last Sunday with a friend visiting from overseas for a traditional English roast. We sat upstairs in the restaurant area - great atmosphere, service was not rushed and excellent food. I love the review earlier that describes the place as casually posh - totally on the money. The downstairs bar was full when we were leaving and looked like the might start filming Made in Chelsea at any moment! Will definitely be back

QS-MkDBC6JbPz2kleCtadw.text: Great pub in chelsea. Has delicious food all day long and just a pleasant atmosphere. Decoration is very tasteful and well done. I generally get a pizza and have always been happy with them. Went in once for breakfast but find it slightly pricey for what they offer. Gets packed quite quickly so be sure to reserve if you do wish to dine in.

4AJ0HUEbV5DZm8tyjM20rQ.text: We came here on a works night out during the summer and it was overall a pretty pleasant evening.They have a gorgeous (but small) upstairs outdoor roof terrace which is lovely and intimate - a nice place to spend having a glass of wine with friends.The decor inside is very refined and clean, not really my taste, but nice nonetheless.There is a lot of space in this pub - the upstairs dining area, downstairs dining area, and then the regular bar area.We were dining and reserved ahead of time being a fairly large group so we were seated upstairs. The food was good, not outstanding, but definitely okay. I was really glad I wasn't paying as I wasn't blown away and it is on the expensive side.Service was attentive and friendly.We hung around after dinner drinking wine on the pavement outside the pub. It's the London way - despite living here for quite some time now, I still don't get it? Maybe I'm lazy, but I'd prefer a seat to sit on to relax and enjoy my wine, rather than standing awkwardly outside with all the smokers sharing their poison with me (I'm an ex smoker myself, I'm not judging!)

7JfrroSDiaPDspdOFvucCw.text: Wish it was possible to give a zero star rating because the Orange doesn't even deserve 1 star, mostly due to horrendous service and mediocre food.We reserved a table for 8 the other day. I was quite impressed by the look and feel of the place. Rustic, laid back, airy, very pleasant. However, that's where the positives end.We ordered a bunch of different items including 4 pizzas, a steak, beef ribs, a haloumi salad, polenta plus some apps. It took a full 45 minutes to get some of the food. The pizzas came out and we were told that the other dishes would be there in minutes. We were told that the kitchen was busy and that there was nothing they could do. A full one and a half hours after initially ordering, and lots of promises that the food was "on its way" the rest of the orders appeared. The flow and fun of the dining experience was totally ruined by their incompetence. The guys who ordered pizzas were already done and now the others had to just get started on their entrees.The service (waitstaff and the kitchen) was beyond slow the entire evening despite the place being no more than half full. I also have to say, the food quality was nothing special. From what our party said; the pizzas were average, the steak was good, the polenta was flavorless, the ribs were disappointing and overcooked, and the salad was mostly greens and not much else.After we finally finished, the waiter had the nerve to come out and ask if we wanted to order dessert. Sorry, we didn't have another hour and a half to wait for more mediocre food to come out.They gave us 15% off the check and also comped one of the meals, but still, it didn't make a horrible experience any better.

SJgKiBNBKU968lLaAjx2Qw.text: I live locally and eat and drink here very often.  Most people around here have buckets of money. We don't but the staff treat us the same.  The cocktails are good. Very good.. They serve a bunch of wines by the glass.  Their food is absolutely beautiful.  The express lunch is a winner.  I've tried roast dinners,  salads, the wood fired pizzas and dozens of other dishes.  Portions are generous  desserts a highlight and coffee excellent.  I had a particularly stand out Ham hock terrine the other day.  The soft cheese they serve with the sweet potato fries is addictive.  They are dog friendly even in the dining room and will bring over a bowl of water for your pooch when you sit down.  I've never had off service here and the staff are truly always outstanding.  Outside space is always a bonus.  Downstairs can be pretty loud in the dining room but don't be fooled by the crowds as there is another beautiful slightly quieter space upstairs.  Just ask

VoIYyw3sRBggsRNrWQeCyg.text: Cool pub with a nice and cozy atmosphere but disappointing food. tuna carpaccio (2 stars) - very weak. almost like they skimped on the seasoning and oil on top. rather tasteless.ribeye steak (2 stars) - asked for medium and it came out rare and bloody. i'm usually a medium-medium well person so this was inedible for me. disappointing. chips (3.5 stars) - the chips (aka french fries) and bearnaise dipping sauce were the highlight of my whole dinner.Bottom line: Perhaps an off night, but dinner was a disappointment unless you consider chips your main meal. However, service was very nice or "lovely" as they say here so I will be generous and get them barely 3 stars.

JTzKx1clKGJyEDUMDG2DpA.text: Had lunch here on a Bank Holiday Monday with 3 friends and a baby. We booked a table (you can only do this for the upstairs restaurant) and the staff were lovely, efficient and accommodating for the pram & baby.The menu is really varied (in a good way) and the service was great. The food excellent - would recommend their pizza bread as a starter - delicious. I also had the steak & mushroom pie which was yummy - not large portions though. Ok for me but big eaters might be a little disappointed - you can always order sides though.This place isn't cheap but the cost wasnt suprising given the menu/location/decor etc. We took our time and they didn't try to hurry us up or kick us out which always gets a big thumbs up in my book!Would highly recommend - get in early for downstairs or book for upstairs as it was certainly very popoular.

zfUV19iLcie6uBZSY2Aimw.text: Had brunch upstairs on a weekend. Beware - the breakfast menu on Saturday switches over to a lunch menu in the early afternoon. In other words, I didn't get eggs for brunch. The food was very good nonetheless and the space is bright and airy and quite quaint and pretty, like a few other London gastropub venues. Nothing really stood out for me though.

I4IMdNmUoetSKlhzSdRzBg.text: Lovely service, warm atmosphere, great food.  Not quite as delicious as its sister restaurant, the thomas cubitt, but very good nonetheless.  We sat and sat and sat and didn't realize we were the last people in the restaurant -- the staff never blinked an eye.  "Please!" they said, "Stay as long as you like!"  It really was very sweet of them.  Plenty of other places would have joyfully thrown us out.Stick with wine (they have a comfortable selection at reasonable prices), cocktails are not their strength.

EgWhp68D0mSjs3IbQFzE3g.text: After popping in here for a drink after a Yelp event last year, I decided this was the place to host our admin Holiday party that I was coordinating. The Orange was very accomodating, even when we arrived a bit late. We ordered plenty of wine and sat back with really excellent starters (my oysters were delightful and the presentation was excellent...I heard equally excellent things about the fried Squid), good-if-small-portions main (I had the fish of the day and risotto) and desserts...for some it was pretty pear tarts, for others it was an espresso martini (I don't think you even need two guesses to know which group I was in).It's priced at what a shabby chic gastropub in Victoria would cost...pricey but completely do-able on a budget. The wine is also a fair deal, £4 for a large glass of Spanish wine (not the house). This may become our new haunt when we move offices to Victoria!

J_dq6yfzN84gJ2Ck0lrJfg.text: I went here for a Ptivate function  and had a great time. The pub is old and new decor downstairs. A  full bar, excellent staff , delicious canapes , food was very fresh and modern. When you walk in there is a bar on the left , a restaurant on the right and the private area downstairs. It was a free bar this night so I cant mention prices but considering the area and the service, Its a classy joint and you get what you pay for . I had my jacket taken and hung up for me when I walked in by the gorgeous waiter . lots of standing area and lounges and chairs. Low lighting , very ambient .One of the better function rooms Ive been to. They even have a hotel upstairs.  Im keen to try the restaurant here because the food that we did have was so nice.

vkSXGz3PZtdjdz37NL4Nng.text: Very loud, impossible to talk without yelling at your dinner partner, but frankly, to be expected.  The manager was a different story, antagonistic and unhelpful, basically telling us that we were unsophisticated idiots when we asked about the parmesan potatoes "Roast Devon lamb rump, parmesan potato & aubergine" which tasted quite like blue cheese.  We thought we'd been mistaken when we'd ordered, so asked our server if they were parmesan or blue cheese.  When we questioned it, the manager came over and told us that they couldn't be bleu cheese, that there was NO blue cheese in the restaurant -- c'mon -- a restaurant without blue cheese somewhere in the kitchen?  And, he insisted that they put goat cheese in with the parmesan so that's what we were tasting.  Dismissed us out of hand and walked away.  Nothing off the bill nor even a coffee.  Our server offered to take the service charge off, but it wasn't her fault.  I'd but this one on the miss list unless it's the only table in the neighborhood.  Oh... and my "Roast chicken & green been salad, tarragon & garlic dressing"?  Boiled chicken and a few green beans thrown over basic salad greens with too many sun-dried tomatoes from a jar.  Fairly tasteless except for the tomatoes.

06QxO90oMqC2Rp1V-IkBOQ.text: Read about the orange in my Fodor's guide.  Went well out of my way to give it a try on a Sunday evening.  I get there and the hostess tells me they're "all out of mains."  Seriously, you have sold out of every one of the main courses on your menu?  All I could order was several of their pizzas.  I can't say if the food was any good (it wasn't that crowded, I had a seat immediately) because I left immediately.  If I were the manager, I would have come in Monday morning and fired whoever ordered the food for my restaurant.

fyYeksqm1ct-5JeYxgg6eQ.text: We took a visiting family member here and really enjoyed it. The room was nice and bright, well-decorated and comfortable. We each ordered very different items from the menu and loved them. The vegetarian options were just as tasty and succulent as the fish and meat. The dessert we ordered involved peanuts and ice cream and a rich cake, and was delicious. My better half said it was the best dessert he'd ever had. I would love to come back here again and again.

1Y9lL--0n2csxHiSUqLyRA.text: I had my birthday lunch here, and everything was spot on. Ambience was absolutely beautiful -- both inside and the surrounding area. The room we booked (Music Room) even had access to an outdoor terrace, which would be perfect for standing reception. Food was very good. I really liked my calamari starter, which was cooked perfectly and generous in portions. Service was excellent as well. Our server Ursula was very kind and thorough to the end. The process of making the booking was easy too -- very responsive and helpful on emails. I highly recommend it for any private parties. I would go back in a heartbeat!

_RudsRE6U789BikPZX7KvA.text: Wow! I had one of my favorite dishes I've ever had while eating out at this place. The cheese salad is a must have. Lots of little flavor details working together on the plate. The wine I ordered was so smooth. The service was fantastic. The design of the building was beautiful and made for a warm, comfortable dining experience. If I lived closer, I'd be here often!

fQvf85J1ZO7YAH3uEzXzTw.text: Came for the Sunday roast! Delicious beef with generous portions. Perfectly cooked vegetables and a yummy gravy and horseradish sauce. They have an IPA here for those who are tired of the European lagers. Very cute atmosphere. We split 3 plates of the Sunday toast and got a salad for 4 people...plenty to go around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom

jLreD5RUCiGSCzmD9kxBPg.text: I remembered it being much, much better.Service was friendly, to be honest it needed to be as the food wasn't especially brilliant, and it took forever to arrive, and when it did, it came in dribs and drabs...kitchen was having a meltdownSo why 3 stars? Previous visits have been better, it's still a lovely lovely dining room...and quite frankly if you want to see the best shades of red/pink corduroy trousers in town...well here's your option.

photos.caption: Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom. So so burger and fries, after a long, long wait
Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom

eDimh-4QYFxupxX42lY0xQ.text: Had lunch in the upstairs dining room. Cozy, rustic atmosphere. The food is good - more gastropub than pub but not quite restaurant. We may have got caught in a  change of shift, so service, while friendly, was not proactive and a bit forgetful. Reasonable pricing.

EzeGWC3LgVieUdDi3IwwIw.text: It was so good we had to come back on our last night in London. The wait staff are very attentive. Cocktails were refreshing. Food was locally sourced and quite tasty. We will certainly return next time we're in London.

2htdvP_dqvuZmwS_eeyL_Q.text: Really enjoyed my Full English! The eggs were cooked perfectly and everything was very tasty. Tea was not my favourite, and at 3£ i think it should have been excellent. Service was okay, what you would expect of an English restaurant. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom. Full English with eggs scrambled soft.

wQ2ib5pcyV4OwAwmm68A0w.text: Just finished dinner. Wesley was our server and he was amazing. I have a lot of food allergies and he found the perfect meal for me. All of our meals were delicious. We also had our toddler with us and he treated her like royalty. We highly recommend this restaurant!

tD5jE2ZIwO5JucRlDBOFRg.text: Nice gastro pub which translated means improved food quality to go with your drinks.Great service and simple menu. Calamari was great. Pizza was okay. The bottom needed a little more browning and crispness.Nice crowd and good vibe. We will be back soon.

ZsVurdRHs1zNfb0pIJ4bpg.text: Simply the best pub in the Pimlico/Victoria area. Highly recommended.

OFF87UHDG4dTRVYDSPi2eA.text: I think this must be one of Thomas Cubitt's houses in Belgravia. It has been beautifully restored, as have this companies other restaurants, and has an upscale clientele to match it's upscale food and wine. The menu is seasonal and creative. I don't care what you order it will be of the highest quality and the presentation will be proper. The staff is well trained and ever so charming.This establishment is properly called The Orange Public House and Hotel. Alas they have only four rooms, but they are delightful in every way with four star amenities. If you are doing business in the area or just doing an architectural romp this is a place to consider.I have made this my locus for London when I yearn for a bit of Cubitt and the beautiful buildings he created.I headed for their ground floor bar which is informal and allows chairs and tables on Pimlico and then moved up to the second floor dining room with a more formal feel and a different menu; not pubgrub! Their roasted pigeon breast with cherry and dark chocolate jus, Jersey Royal Potatos with mint butter and a so delicate almond and orange cake spotted with pomegranate jam and clotted cream. My companion had pea soup, speck, orange and chervil mascarpone, Yellowfin tuna, samphire, smoked yoghurt and tomato and fennel ragout. That was followed by lemon posset with passion fruit jelly and mint meringues, all beautifully prepared and served.This is not at all complicated food preparation and it's high time South Florida took a look at this pub's menu and stopped with the over fried, greasy, frozen talapia, chix wings, and burgers for $15. When will they ever learn?

photos.caption: Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom. Four rooms only but upscale
Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom. Pea soup/smooth and creamy
Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom

XfwbmIxy_dOwW1b_NfTLFg.text: The Orange is one of my favourite places for roast in West London. It's an atmospheric bistro pub with great British fare. The 2 story restaurant is covered in clean light coloured wood.Their pizza bread with chilies and olive oil is a highlight of my Sundays. I've had the beef rib and pork for roast both of which are recommended. There are also a wide selection of tasty looking pizzas, but being lactose intolerant I always stick to the roasts. The tend to run out of some of the roasts, so worth trying to snag a table on the earlier side (ie before 3pm) otherwise you might be stuck with chicken which would be a downer if beef is on your mind.The service is always slow, exceptionally slow sometimes. Just accept that, order more than a few Sunday funday beverages and you'll enjoy your meal.

IQg1fg1El4hPVlMNH_6Sxw.text: I'm not a fun of the pubs cuisine but this is a good one. Modern design, nice and cosy ,bit slowly the service but the food is good. I would recommend the burgers.A must visit at least once

y5p1SOLOO9jUOL7Nquqm9Q.text: Nice food and great setting. Small portions. Downstairs can be noisy so ask for an upstairs table. I will go back.

RnGUeEkWEwWwSG22tFdMag.text: We found this place on Yelp.   (Thank you to the previous reviewers for your reviews.) We had two fish dishes.   Both well prepared, perfectly cooked with lots of flavor.   The courgette side was also very nice with a slight spiciness.   Service was excellent.   As was the coconut cake dessert.   Good selection of beers as well.  Thumbs up!

Uq4jr-86G2EKqkjTa2kH-g.text: Really nice drinks place in Chelsea - good atmosphere and vibe. Had the gin and tonic - loce martin millers so glad they were using that brand. Would come back to try the food

Fwt3O51RMQ2ylu-BMXGEcg.text: Coming here on a recommendation of my mum's (which sometimes I treat with a certain amount of trepidation), I was very pleasantly rewarded with my first ever visit.The decor and ambience here is definitely of the Gastro Pub ilk, but without a doubt The Orange does it with a superior style and panache. The atmosphere is light and airy, and this adds to a great vibe to take in while you munch.Some of the menu items change from time to time, so I will not list the individual dishes, but suffice to say they were all impressive and came with truly scrumptious sides.I am not normally a dessert type person, but I even succumbed to the amazing ice cream here. Everybody else ordered it and I said no. I was offered a taste. And I called the waiter back over immediately! Amazing!All in all an extremely solid performer in all areas. Well done to The Orange.

pJyajOauk2jM9L6LJTHmLw.text: I went there on a first date and had a few pleasant drinks before sitting down outside for some yummy pizza. However i soon got my handbag stolen which put a dampener on the night. What made it totally bearable however was how friendly the staff were about it. They immediately waved the bill and helped provide all the information to the police etc. Their reaction was so friendly it made me love the place.The entire place is very relaxing and nice. The indoor eating areas are so beautifully laid out, I loved it! Definitely go for it!

apioXBw4PeFXZMvBa1cneA.text: Loved it!!!  Great cocktail (had the sage one), really enjoyed the Sunday roast and amazing cheesecake!!  Very accommodating with our kids as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Orange - London, United Kingdom

YqAGAN_ifwBRAP3qTnVzkQ.text: Food ok, terrible service, especially if a big group. We were 8, it took them an hour to bring the starters, and another hour before the mains showed up.
